title: ADCs are all overpowered now
body:
Ive seen 5-6 pro games now where they are running the protect the ADC comps with 3 supports. This is the worst part of LoL right here. Losers on the forums whine about assassins and Riot listens and they all get gutted within the month. For some reason Riot is leaving Zed and Kass alone but have no fears they will be gone soon.

Is this what you guys like the best? 1 ADC getting 3 pentas a game? Is this what LoL is about?

-AP mid mana regen nerfs
-Assassins out of control in laning phase
-Assassins removed from game within the month
-ADC's have no counters
-ADC's allowed to have no counters for 2 3 4 months?

I am watching 2 of the best teams in the world, EDG vs IG and I want to throw my TV out the window watching this Trist + nunu/lulu/janna game. Disgusting and shameful that LoL is balanced this way.

replies.body:
It's not like assassins are weak. Its more about ADCs being worshipped and forced to be excellent kiters to be useful. To catch a Kalista you now need point and click CC/two gapclosers or more/Veigar's E/long range abilities. To catch a Vayne, you need pinks/not be any kind of tank or bruiser because of her anti-melee kit/longer AA range/AoE effects/a pull.

Meanwhile, to catch an older ADC like Ashe, all you need to do is approach her from a location that isn't warded, she won't dash, knock you back or anything, and even if she does stun you or flash, one gapcloser that isn't Volibear/Garen/Udyr level of frustrating will catch her.

The high damage dealers are in a state that they get to burst down defense stackers that are in the game precisely to punish them for focusing the tank. BotRK, LW, VS, lifesteal and all that %HP you see everywhere is another hit to the stomach of the feeble tank race that hardly even manages to stand up now, because engages are becoming more and more pointless, burst is ten times more cost efficient than defense, and every support/ADC gets to completely nulify any attempt at picking off a carry unless they make a mistake so big that the game is already 1-sided by the time teamfights start.

Then we also have the mana regen nerf problems, that make buffing assassins impossible since they already dominate mid. We have ranged champions going top, bullying better than most melees and outscaling them too, we have the insane mobility meta that makes running as a gapcloser completely pointless, we have little viable tank items, low mobility tanks that can't even fit the meta, an overall anti-melee meta enforced even by the new champions that have come out (Kalista/Gnar).

The problem is, ADCs are hard to adjust. You can nerf their base damage and everything, but as long as they are able to get to mid-late game, they are going to crap on everything in sight due to their standard item build. Riot can't do anything to ADCs without adjusting their items first and/or reworking crit.

This is not hate against you but hate against Riot.
I'd back your argument if Riot didn't massively buff the ADC class in the ADC patch (This was an itemization patch). Was it necessary to remove the BT botlane dominance? Yes. Did it  make the ADC class more of a bitch to deal with? You fuckin' betcha.

Also, yes the ADC's job IS to focus the closest priority target, but tanks have bottom priority generally. And yes, I am perfectly aware that there are situations in which focusing the tank is pretty much unavoidable. I've been in those situations. They're frustrating. But at the same time, ideally you shouldn't focus the tank. The enemy ADC/APC/Assassin should be your first target depending on who's fed and who isn't. Then the support and tank. Their itemization has more to do with making their own strengths shine and becoming overbearing rather than being reactive to a teams build. So in a sense they are inherently powerful and are given more or less free range to ignore any items that may be picked up to be used against them, because there arent many items that are built to go against ADC's. {{item:3153}}  will beat {{item:3083}}  , {{item:3075}} ,  and {{item:3143}} . To top it off they get more HP than they really should have through {{item:3072}} . The only reason ADC's are so potent is because their items are so gold efficient and there aren't any defensive items that can mitigate their potency. Shutting down adc's can be done of course but to do that you have to do so using powerful champions and coordinated team play. You do have to consider that Thornmail isn't a cut and dry 30% return, there are 2 large things to consider when calculating damage taken VS healing done.

Thornmail's damage is based off of the damage of the auto attack before armor, so stacking armor means you take less damage while the attacker takes the same damage.
Thornmail's damage return is magic damage though, this means that if the attacker has a lot of magic resist they will take less damage from thornmail.

This would be a fine system if it wasn't for the fact that while Last whisper penetrates the armor that scales up Thornmail, most tanks/bruisers can't afford/fit spell penetration items to make the damage return on it better.
